intro: Senecio greenmanianus, commonly known as Greenman's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Senecio greenmanianus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
